supportedLocales.description: Array of strings representing all Smartsheet-supported locales.

id.description:
Share Id.

**NOTE**: unlike other Smartsheet object Ids, this Id is an alphanumeric string.

groupId.description: Group Id if the share is a group share, else null.

userId.description: User Id if the share is a user share, else null.

type.description: The type of this share. One of the following values: GROUP or USER.

ccMe.description:
Indicates whether to send a copy of the email to the sharer of the sheet. You can specify this attribute
in a request, but it is never present in a response.

email.description: User's primary email address for user shares; null for group shares.

message.description:
The message included in the body of the email that is optionally sent to the recipient. You can specify
this attribute in a request, but it is never present in a response.

name.description: If a user share and user is also a contact, the user's full name. If a group share, the group's name.

scope.description:
The scope of this share. One of the following values:
  * **ITEM**: an item-level share (that is, the specific object to which the share applies is shared with
    the user or group).
  * **WORKSPACE**: a workspace-level share (that is, the workspace that contains the object to which the
    share applies is shared with the user or group).

subject.description:
The subject of the email that is optionally sent to notify the recipient. You can specify this attribute
in a request, but it is never present in a response.

fromId.description: The Id of the template from which to create the sheet. This attribute can be specified in a request, but is never present in a response.

ownerId.description: User Id of the sheet owner.

attachments.description:
Array of Attachment objects.
Only returned if the [include](/api/smartsheet/openapi/sheets/getsheet) query string parameter contains **attachments**.

cellImageUploadEnabled.description: The sheet is enabled for cell images to be uploaded.

crossSheetReferences.description:
Array of CrossSheetReference objects.
Only returned if the [include](/api/smartsheet/openapi/sheets/getsheet) query string parameter contains **crossSheetReferences**.

discussions.description:
Array of Discussion objects
Only returned if the [include](/api/smartsheet/openapi/sheets/getsheet) query string parameter contains **discussions**.

effectiveAttachmentOptions.description: Array of enum strings (see [Attachment.attachmentType](/api/smartsheet/openapi/attachments) indicating the allowable attachment options for the current user and sheet.

favorite.description: **Deprecated** Returned only if the user has marked this sheet as a favorite in their Home tab (value = **true**).

hasSummaryFields.description: Indicates whether a sheet summary is present.

owner.description: Email address of the sheet owner.

permalink.description: URL that represents a direct link to the sheet in Smartsheet.

readOnly.description: Returned only if the sheet belongs to an expired trial (value = **true**).

resourceManagementEnabled.description: Indicates that resource management is enabled.

resourceManagementType.description: Resource Management type. Indicates the type of RM that is enabled.

showParentRowsForFilters.description: Returned only if there are column filters on the sheet. Value = **true** if "show parent rows" is enabled for the filters.

totalRowCount.description: The total number of rows in the sheet.

version.description: A number that is incremented every time a sheet is modified.

format.description: One of the following values: **EXCEL**, **PDF**, or **PDF_GANTT**.

icalEnabled.description: If **true**, a webcal is available for the calendar in the sheet.

icalUrl.description: URL for **iCal** view of the published sheet. Only returned in a response if **icalEnabled = true**.

readOnlyFullAccessibleBy.description:
Indicates who can access the 'Read-Only Full' view of the published sheet:
  * ALL - available to anyone who has the link.
  * ORG - available only to members of the sheet owner's Smartsheet organization account.
  * SHARED - available only to users shared to the item.

Only returned in the response if **readOnlyFullEnabled = true**.

readOnlyFullDefaultView.description: Indicates which view the user has set for a read-only, default view of the published sheet. Must be one of the listed enum values.

readOnlyFullEnabled.description: If **true**, a rich version of the sheet is published with the ability to download row attachments and discussions.

readOnlyFullShowToolbar.description: **Deprecated** Indicates whether the left nav toolbar is displayed. The default, or **true**, is to display the toolbar. If **false**, hides the toolbar.

readOnlyFullUrl.description: URL for 'Read-Only Full' view of the published sheet. Only returned in a response if **readOnlyFullEnabled = true.

readOnlyLiteEnabled.description: If **true**, a lightweight version of the sheet is published without row attachments and discussions.

readOnlyLiteSslUrl.description: URL for 'Read-Only' view of the published sheet when SSL is enabled.

readOnlyLiteUrl.description: URL for 'Read-Only HTML' view of the published sheet. Only returned in a response if **readOnlyLiteEnabled = true**.

readWriteAccessibleBy.description:
Indicates who can access the 'Edit by Anyone' view of the published sheet:
  * ALL - available to anyone who has the link.
  * ORG - available only to members of the sheet owner's Smartsheet organization account.
  * SHARED - available only to users shared to the item.

Only returned in the response if **readWriteEnabled = true**.

readWriteDefaultView.description: Indicates which view the user has set for a read-write, default view of the published sheet. Must be one of the listed enum values.

readWriteEnabled.description: If **true**,a rich version of the sheet is published with the ability to edit cells and manage attachments and discussions.

readWriteShowToolbar.description: **Deprecated** Indicates whether the left nav toolbar is displayed. The default, or **true**, is to display the toolbar. If **false**, hides the toolbar.

readWriteUrl.description: URL for 'Edit by Anyone' view of the published sheet. Only returned in a response if **readWriteEnabled = true**.

SheetSummary.description: Represents the entire summary, or a list of defined fields and values, for a specific sheet.

fields.description: Array of summary (or metadata) fields defined on the sheet.

SheetUserPermissions.description: Describes the current user's editing permissions for a specific sheet.

summaryPermissions.description:
One of:
  * ADMIN: full control over fields.
  * READ_DELETE: sheet is owned by an individual account that doesn't have summary capabilities. If a summary exists, the only possible operations are GET and DELETE fields.
  * READ_ONLY.
  * READ_WRITE: can edit values of existing fields, but not create or delete fields, nor modify field type.

SheetUserSettings.description: Represents individual user settings for a specific sheet. User settings may be updated even on sheets where the current user only has read access (for example, viewer permissions or a read-only sheet).

criticalPathEnabled.description: Does this user have "Show Critical Path" turned on for this sheet? **NOTE**: This setting only has an effect on project sheets with dependencies enabled.

displaySummaryTasks.description: Does this user have "Display Summary Tasks" turned on for this sheet? Applies only to sheets where "Calendar View" has been configured.

order.description: The display order for the ShortcutWidgetItem object.

defaultWidgetBackgroundColor.description: The hex color of the background color for all widgets except for title widgets on the dashboard, for instance `#E6F5FEF4` or `#E6F5FE`.

columnCount.description: Number of columns that the dashboard contains.

workspace.description: A reference to the dashboard's workspace, if the dashboard is in a workspace; otherwise an empty value.

readOnlyFullAccessibleBy.description:
Indicates who can access the 'Read-Only Full' view of the published dashboard. Only returned in the response if **readOnlyFullEnabled = true**.
  * **ALL** - available to anyone who has the link.
  * **ORG** - available only to members of the dashboard owner's Smartsheet organization account.
  * **SHARED** - available only to users shared to the item.

---
If **readOnlyFullEnabled** is set to true in the request, but **readOnlyFullAccessibleBy** is not specified, the value of **readOnlyFullAccessibleBy** defaults to the organization-level 'Dashboard Publishing' setting (if the dashboard owner belongs to an organization account) or to **ALL** (if the dashboard owner does not belong to an organization account).

interactionType.description:
Specifies what happens when a user clicks the widget. The type will determine what other properties are needed.
 * DISTI_COPY - a distribution link, only available if org has distribution links enabled.
 * NONE - do nothing, no other attribute required.
 * SMARTSHEET_ITEM - open a Smartsheet item that is not the SOURCE_SHEET, must also have one of the following attributes:
    * dashboardId
    * folderId
    * reportId
    * sheetId
    * workspaceId
 * SOURCE_SHEET - open the container where the widget data comes from, no other attribute required.
 * WEB -  launch the URL, must also have url attribute.

CrossSheetReferenceRequestWithColumnIds.description: CrossSheetReference object to create which will refer to the entire columns in the range from startColumnId to endColumnId.

name.description: Friendly name of reference. Auto-generated unless specified in Create Cross-sheet References.

endColumnId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more columns. Must be used with startColumnId.

startColumnId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more columns. Must be used with endColumnId.

CrossSheetReferenceRequestWithRowIds.description: CrossSheetReference object to create which will refer to the entire rows in the range from startRowId to endRowId.

name.description: Friendly name of reference. Auto-generated unless specified in Create Cross-sheet References.

endRowId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more rows. Must be used with startRowId.

startRowId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more rows. Must be used with endRowId.

CrossSheetReferenceRequestWithColumnAndR.description: CrossSheetReference object to create with specified cell range.

name.description: Friendly name of reference. Auto-generated unless specified in Create Cross-sheet References.

endColumnId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more columns. Must be used with startColumnId. To specify an entire column, omit the startRowId and endRowId parameters.

endRowId.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more rows. Must be used with startRowId. To specify an entire row, omit the startColumnId and endColumnId parameters.

startColumnId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more columns. Must be used with endColumnId. To specify an entire column, omit the startRowId and endRowId parameters.

startRowId.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more rows. Must be used with endRowId. To specify an entire row, omit the startColumnId and endColumnId parameters.

title.description: Title for the attachment. Only used with an attachment.

file.description: File to attach to the new comment. Only used with an attachment.
File to attach to the new comment. Only used with an attachment.

icalEnabled.description: If **true**, a webcal is available for the calendar in the sheet.

readOnlyFullAccessibleBy.description:
Indicates who can access the 'Read-Only Full' view of the published sheet:
  * ALL - available to anyone who has the link.
  * ORG - available only to members of the sheet owner's Smartsheet organization account.
  * SHARED - available only to users shared to the item.

Only returned in the response if **readOnlyFullEnabled = true**.

readOnlyFullDefaultView.description: Indicates which view the user has set for a read-only, default view of the published sheet. Must be one of the listed enum values.

readOnlyFullEnabled.description: If **true**, a rich version of the sheet is published with the ability to download row attachments and discussions.

readOnlyFullShowToolbar.description: **Deprecated** Indicates whether the left nav toolbar is displayed. The default, or **true**, is to display the toolbar. If **false**, hides the toolbar.

readOnlyLiteEnabled.description: If **true**, a lightweight version of the sheet is published without row attachments and discussions.

readWriteAccessibleBy.description:
Indicates who can access the 'Edit by Anyone' view of the published sheet:
  * ALL - available to anyone who has the link.
  * ORG - available only to members of the sheet owner's Smartsheet organization account.
  * SHARED - available only to users shared to the item.

Only returned in the response if **readWriteEnabled = true**.

readWriteDefaultView.description: Indicates which view the user has set for a read-write, default view of the published sheet. Must be one of the listed enum values.

readWriteEnabled.description: If **true**,a rich version of the sheet is published with the ability to edit cells and manage attachments and discussions.

readWriteShowToolbar.description: **Deprecated** Indicates whether the left nav toolbar is displayed. The default, or **true**, is to display the toolbar. If **false**, hides the toolbar.

SheetPublishRequest.description: Describes the sheet's publish settings. Used as a request body to set publish status.

columnId.description: The Id of the column that the cell is located in.

columnType.description: Only returned if the include query string parameter contains **columnType**.

value.description: A string, number, or a Boolean value -- depending on the cell type and the data in the cell. Cell values larger than 4000 characters are silently truncated. An empty cell returns no value.

displayValue.description: Visual representation of cell contents, as presented to the user in the UI.

parentRowNumber.description: The row number of the parent.

expanded.description: Indicates whether the row is expanded or collapsed.

version.description: Sheet version number that is incremented every time a sheet is modified.

expanded.description: Indicates whether the row is expanded or collapsed.

version.description: Sheet version number that is incremented every time a sheet is modified.

expanded.description: Indicates whether the row is expanded or collapsed.

properties-contactOptions.description: Array of ContactOption objects to specify a pre-defined list of values for the column. Column type must be CONTACT_LIST.

format.description: The format descriptor. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains format and this column has a non-default format applied to it.

formula.description: The formula for a cell, if set.

index.description: Field index or position. This number is zero-based.

locked.description: Indicates whether the field is locked.

properties-options.description: When applicable for PICKLIST column type. Array of the options available for the field.

properties-symbol.description: When applicable for PICKLIST column type.

properties-title.description: Arbitrary name, must be unique within summary.

validation.description: Indicates whether summary field values are restricted to the type.

index.description: Field index or position. This number is zero-based.

title.description: Arbitrary name, must be unique within summary.

locked.description: Indicates whether the field is locked.

lockedForUser.description: Indicates whether the field is locked for the requesting user.

formula.description: The formula for a cell, if set.

version.description: Sheet version number that is incremented every time a sheet is modified.

ownerId.description: Set to a static value of "0".

UserUpdate.description:
Updates User for the following attributes:

* **admin** (required).
* **licensedSheetCreator** (required).
* **firstName** (optional).
* **groupAdmin** (optional).
* **lastName** (optional).
* **resourceViewer** (optional).

admin.description: Indicates whether the user is a system admin (can manage user accounts and organization account).

licensedSheetCreator.description: Indicates whether the user is a licensed user (can create and own sheets).

groupAdmin.description: Indicates whether the user is a group admin (can create and edit groups).

resourceViewer.description: Indicates whether the user is a resource viewer (can access resource views).

callbackUrl.description: HTTPS URL where callbacks are sent.

events.description: Array of the events that are subscribed to. Currently, must be an array of size 1 that contains the string value '\*.\*' (asterisk period asterisk), which means "all objects" and "all events".

version.description: Webhook version. Currently, the only supported value is 1. This attribute is intended to ensure backward compatibility as new webhook functionality is released. For example, a webhook with a version of 1 is guaranteed to always be sent callback objects that are compatible with the version 1 release of webhooks.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the webhook is on (true) or off (false).

FolderNameOnly.description: Can contain dashboards, folders, reports, sheets, or templates.

FolderSimpleResponse.description: Can contain dashboards, folders, reports, sheets, or templates.

scopes.ADMIN_SHEETS: Modify sheet structure, including column definition, publish state, etc.
scopes.ADMIN_USERS: Add and remove users from your Smartsheet organization account; create groups and manage membership.
scopes.ADMIN_WEBHOOKS: Create, delete, and update webhooks; get all webhooks; reset shared secret.
scopes.ADMIN_WORKSPACES: Create and manage workspaces and folders, including sharing.
scopes.READ_SHEETS: Read all sheet data, including attachments, discussions, and cell data.
scopes.READ_USERS: Retrieve users and groups for your Smartsheet organization account.
scopes.SHARE_SHEETS: Share sheets, including sending sheets as attachments.
scopes.WRITE_SHEETS: Insert and modify sheet data, including attachments, discussions, and cell data.

Authorization.name: Authorization
Authorization.description: API Access Token used to authenticate requests to Smartsheet APIs.

includeAll.name: includeAll
includeAll.description: If true, include all results, that is, do not paginate. Mutually exclusive with page and pageSize (they are ignored if includeAll=true is specified).

modifiedSince.name: modifiedSince
modifiedSince.description: When specified with a date and time value, response only includes the objects that are modified on or after the date and time specified. If you need to keep track of frequent changes, it may be more useful to use Get Sheet Version.

numericDates.name: numericDates
numericDates.description: You can optionally choose to receive and send dates/times in numeric format, as milliseconds since the UNIX epoch (midnight on January 1, 1970 in UTC time), using the query string parameter numericDates with a value of true. This query parameter works for any API request.

page.name: page
page.description: Which page to return. Defaults to 1 if not specified. If you specify a value greater than the total number of pages, the last page of results is returned.

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. Unless otherwise stated for a specific endpoint, defaults to 100. If only page is specified, defaults to a page size of 100. For reports, the default is 100 rows. If you need larger sets of data from your report, returns a maximum of 10,000 rows per request.

contactId.name: contactId
contactId.description: contactId of the contact being accessed.

contactInclude.name: include
contactInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response:
  * **profileImage**

Accept-Encoding.name: Accept-Encoding
Accept-Encoding.description:
Strongly recommended to make sure payload is compressed. Must be set to one of the following values:
* deflate
* gzip

favoriteInclude.name: include
favoriteInclude.description: A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: Required for POST and PUT requests. Defines the structure for the request body.

favoriteIds.name: objectIds
favoriteIds.description: A comma-separated list of Ids of the favorited item.

favoriteId.name: favoriteId
favoriteId.description: Favorite Id, e.g., sheet Id, report Id.

folderId.name: folderId
folderId.description: Folder Id where you can create sheets, sights, reports, templates, and other folders.

folderWorkspaceInclude.name: include
folderWorkspaceInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response:
  * **source** - adds the Source object indicating which object the folder was created from, if any
  * **distributionLink**
  * **ownerInfo** Returns the user with owner permissions, or the user with admin permissions if there is no owner assigned. If no owner or admins are assigned, the Plan Asset Admin is returned. If no Plan Asset Admin is assigned, the System Admin is returned.
  * **sheetVersion**
  * **permalinks**

sheetCopyInclude.name: include
sheetCopyInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of elements to copy:
  * **attachments**
  * **cellLinks** - includes cross-sheet references
  * **data** - includes formatting
  * **discussions** - includes comments
  * **filters**
  * **forms**
  * **ruleRecipients** -- includes notification recipients, must also include rules when using this attribute
  * **rules** -- includes notifications and workflow rules
  * **shares** |
NOTE: Cell history is not copied, regardless of which include parameter values are specified.

sheetCopyExclude.name: exclude
sheetCopyExclude.description: When specified with a value of **sheetHyperlinks**, excludes this category from the response

skipRemap.name: skipRemap
skipRemap.description: A comma-separated list of references to NOT re-map for the newly created folder.

include.name: include
include.description:
Additional parameter to create a sheet from template.
A comma-separated list of elements to copy from the template.

Content-Disposition.name: Content-Disposition
Content-Disposition.description: Should be equal to "attachment" to tell the API that a file is in the body of the POST request, followed by a semicolon, followed by **filename=** and the URL-encoded filename in quotes

parameters-Content-Type.name: Content-Type
parameters-Content-Type.description:
Required for POST request to import a sheet from CSV/XLSX file.
* For CSV files, use: Content-Type: text/csv
* For XLSX files, use: Content-Type: application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet

headerRowIndex.name: headerRowIndex
headerRowIndex.description:
A zero-based integer indicating the row number to use for column names. Rows before this are omitted.
If not specified, the default values are Column1, Column2, etc.

primaryColumnIndex.name: primaryColumnIndex
primaryColumnIndex.description: A zero-based integer indicating the column to designate as primary.

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

accessApiLevel.name: accessApiLevel
accessApiLevel.description: Allows COMMENTER access for inputs and return values. For backwards-compatibility, VIEWER is the default. For example, to see whether a user has COMMENTER access for a sheet, use accessApiLevel=1.

reportId.name: reportId
reportId.description: reportID of the report being accessed.

reportInclude.name: include
reportInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response:
  * **attachments**
  * **discussions**
  * **proofs**
  * **format**
  * **objectValue** - when used in combination with a level query parameter, includes the email addresses for multi-contact data
  * **scope** - adds the report's scope to the response
  * **source** - adds the Source object indicating which report the report was created from, if any
  * **sourceSheets**

reportExclude.name: exclude
reportExclude.description: A comma-separated list of optional elements to not include in the response

reportLevel.name: level
reportLevel.description: specifies whether new functionality, such as multi-contact data is returned in a backwards-compatible, text format (level=0, default), multi-contact data (level=1), or multi-picklist data (level=3).

sharingInclude.name: sharingInclude
sharingInclude.description: When applicable for the specific object this parameter defines the scope of the share. Possible values are ITEM or WORKSPACE. ITEM is an item-level share (that is, the specific object to which the share applies is shared with the user or group). WORKSPACE is a workspace-level share (that is, the workspace that contains the object to which the share applies is shared with the user or group).

sendEmail.name: sendEmail
sendEmail.description: Either true or false to indicate whether to notify the user by email. Default is false. If true, limit is 1000 emails.

query.name: query
query.description: Text with which to perform the search. Enclose in double-quotes for an exact search.

location.name: location
location.description: **Deprecated** When specified with a value of **personalWorkspace**, limits the response to only those items in the user's workspaces.

parameters-include.name: include
parameters-include.description: When specified with a value of **favoriteFlag**, response indicates which returned items are favorites.  favorite -- dashboards, folders, reports, sheets, templates, and workspaces will have the property favorite: true parentObjectFavorite -- attachments, discussions, summary fields, and rows will have the property parentObjectFavorite: true

scopes.name: scopes
scopes.description: If search fails, try using an array for each type of this comma-separated list of search filters.

sheetId.name: sheetId
sheetId.description: Sheet Id of the sheet being accessed.

sheetInclude.name: include
sheetInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response:
* **sheetVersion** - current version number of each sheet, should not be combined with pagination
* **source** - the Source object for any sheet that was created from another sheet, if any

parameters-sheetInclude.name: include
parameters-sheetInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response:
  * **attachments** - includes the metadata for sheet-level and row-level attachments. To include discussion attachments, both attachments and discussions must be present in the include list.
  * **columnType** -includes columnType attribute in the row's cells indicating the type of the column the cell resides in.
  * **crossSheetReferences** - includes the cross-sheet references
  * **discussions** - includes sheet-level and row-level discussions. To include discussion attachments, both attachments and discussions must be present in the include list.
  * **filters** - includes filteredOut attribute indicating if the row should be displayed or hidden according to the sheet's filters.
  * **filterDefinitions** - includes type of filter, operators used, and criteria
  * **format** -  includes column, row, cell, and summary fields formatting.
  * **ganttConfig** - includes Gantt chart details.
  * **objectValue** - when used in combination with a level query parameter, includes the email addresses for multi-contact data.
  * **ownerInfo** - includes the owner's email address and the owner's user Id.
  * **rowPermalink** - includes permalink attribute that represents a direct link to the row in the Smartsheet application.
  * **source** - adds the Source object indicating which report, sheet  Sight (aka dashboard), or template the sheet was created from, if any.
  * **writerInfo** - includes createdBy and modifiedBy attributes on the row or summary fields, indicating the row or summary field's creator, and last modifier.

sheetExclude.name: exclude
sheetExclude.description:
A comma-separated list of element types to exclude from the response:
  * **filteredOutRows** - excludes filtered-out rows from response payload if a sheet filter is applied; includes total number of filtered rows
  * **linkInFromCellDetails** - excludes the following attributes from the **cell.linkInFromCell** object: `columnId`, `rowId`, `status`
  * **linksOutToCellsDetails** - excludes the following attributes from the **cell.linksOutToCells** array elements: `columnId`, `rowId`, `status`
  * **nonexistentCells** - excludes empty cells

sheetColumnIds.name: columnIds
sheetColumnIds.description: A comma-separated list of column ids. The response contains only the specified columns in the "columns" array, and individual rows' "cells" array only contains cells in the specified columns.

sheetFilterId.name: filterId
sheetFilterId.description: Overrides the existing include={filters} parameter if both are supplied. Applies the given filter (if accessible by the calling user) and marks the affected rows as "filteredOut": true.

sheetIfVersionAfter.name: ifVersionAfter
sheetIfVersionAfter.description: If version specified is still the current sheet version, then returns an abbreviated Sheet object with only the sheet version property. Otherwise, if the sheet has been modified, returns the complete Sheet object. Intended to allow clients with a cached copy to make sure they have the latest version.

sheetLevel.name: level
sheetLevel.description:
Specifies whether object data types, such as multi-contact data are returned in a backwards-compatible, text format in text/number columns.
- Set `level=0` (default) to use text/number columns for multi-contact data and multi-picklist data.
- Set `level=1` to use multiple-entry contact list columns for multi-contact data; multi-picklist data is returned in text/number columns.
- Set `level=2` to use multiple-entry contact list columns for multi-contact data and use multiple-entry picklist columns for multi-picklist data.

sheetRowIds.name: rowIds
sheetRowIds.description: A comma-separated list of row Ids on which to filter the rows included in the result.

sheetRowNumbers.name: rowNumbers
sheetRowNumbers.description: A comma-separated list of row numbers on which to filter the rows included in the result. Non-existent row numbers are ignored.

sheetRowsModifiedSince.name: rowsModifiedSince
sheetRowsModifiedSince.description: Filter to return only rows that have been modified since the date/time provided. Date should be in ISO-8601 format.

automationRuleId.name: automationRuleId
automationRuleId.description: The Id of an Automation Rule

columnsLevel.name: level
columnsLevel.description:
Specifies whether object data types, such as multi-contact data are returned in a backwards-compatible, text format in text/number columns.
- Set `level=0` (default) to use text/number columns for multi-contact data and multi-picklist data.
- Set `level=1` to use multiple-entry contact list columns for multi-contact data; multi-picklist data is returned in text/number columns.
- Set `level=2` to use multiple-entry contact list columns for multi-contact data and use multiple-entry picklist columns for multi-picklist data.

columnId.name: columnId
columnId.description: Column Id in the sheet being accessed.

discussionInclude.name: include
discussionInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response:
  * **attachments** - effective only if comments is present, otherwise ignored
  * **comments** - include all comments in threads

proofId.name: proofId
proofId.description: Proof Id of the original proof

proofInclude.name: include
proofInclude.description: A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response.

allowPartialSuccess.name: allowPartialSuccess
allowPartialSuccess.description: When specified with a value of true, enables partial success for this bulk operation. See [Bulk operations > Partial success](/api/smartsheet/guides/advanced-topics/scalability-options) for more information.

overrideValidation.name: overrideValidation
overrideValidation.description: You may use the query string parameter **overrideValidation** with a value of **true** to allow a cell value outside of the validation limits. You must specify **strict** with a value of **false** to bypass value type checking.

rowIds.name: ids
rowIds.description: A comma-separated list of row Ids.

ignoreRowsNotFound.name: ignoreRowsNotFound
ignoreRowsNotFound.description: **true** or **false**. If set to **false** and any of the specified row Ids are not found, no rows are deleted, and the "not found" [error](/api/smartsheet/openapi/schemas/error) is returned.

copyRowsInclude.name: include
copyRowsInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of row elements to copy in addition to the cell data:
  * **all** - specify a value of **all** to include everything (attachments, children, and discussions).
  * **attachments**
  * **children** -  if specified, any child rows of the rows specified in the request are also copied to the destination sheet, and parent-child relationships amongst rows are preserved within the destination sheet; if not specified, only the rows specified in the request are copied.
  * **discussions**

ignoreRowsNotFoundForCopyRows.name: ignoreRowsNotFound
ignoreRowsNotFoundForCopyRows.description: **true** or **false**: default is **false**. If set to **true**, specifying row Ids that do not exist within the source sheet does not cause an error response. If omitted or set to **false**, specifying row Ids that do not exist within the source sheet causes an error response (and no rows are copied).

moveRowsInclude.name: include
moveRowsInclude.description: A comma-separate list of row elements to move in addition to the cell data.

ignoreRowsNotFoundForMoveRows.name: ignoreRowsNotFound
ignoreRowsNotFoundForMoveRows.description: **true** or **false**: default is **false**. If set to **true**, specifying row Ids that do not exist within the source sheet does not cause an error response. If omitted or set to **false**, specifying row Ids that do not exist within the source sheet causes an error response (and no rows are moved).

rowId.name: rowId
rowId.description: Row Id in the sheet being accessed.

rowInclude.name: include
rowInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of elements to include in the response.

See [Row Include Flags](/api/smartsheet/openapi/rows).

Also supports the **columns** include flag, which adds a columns array that specifies all of the columns for the sheet. This enables you to have the full context of the cells in the row.

The **filters** include flag returns a **filteredOut** attribute indicating if the row should be displayed or hidden according to the sheet's filters.

Content-Length.name: Content-Length
Content-Length.description:
Must be set to the size of the file, in bytes. For example to determine file size using in UNIX:
$ ls -l ProgressReport.docx
5463 ProgressReport.docx

altText.name: altText
altText.description: Url-encoded alternate text for the image

cellHistoryInclude.name: include
cellHistoryInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of elements to copy:
  * **columnType** - includes the columnType attribute for each Cell object
  * **objectValue** - when used in combination with a level query parameter, includes the email addresses for a multi-contact cell.

sheetSummaryInclude.name: include
sheetSummaryInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of elements to include in the response.
* **format**: includes format info for cells, rows, and summary fields
* **writerInfo**: includes createdBy and modifiedBy attributes for rows and summary fields

sheetSummaryExclude.name: exclude
sheetSummaryExclude.description:
A comma-separated list of elements to not include in the response.
* **displayValue**: excludes displayValue info for cells, rows, and summary fields
* **image**: excludes image attributes for cells and summary fields
* **imageAltText**: excludes alt text for cells and summary fields

renameIfConflict.name: renameIfConflict
renameIfConflict.description: Set to true if you want to override the requirement for unique summary field names. Repeated names will be adjusted by appending "(1)" or similar after the field name.

sheetSummaryFieldIds.name: ids
sheetSummaryFieldIds.description: A comma-separated list of Sheet Summary Field Ids.

ignoreSummaryFieldsNotFound.name: ignoreSummaryFieldsNotFound
ignoreSummaryFieldsNotFound.description: If **true**, the operation will succeed even if some fieldIds are not found.

summaryFieldId.name: fieldId
summaryFieldId.description: Summary Field Id of the sheet summary field being accessed.

sortRows.name: include&exclude
sortRows.description: (Optional) Any of the relevant parameters or query parameters listed for [Get Sheet](/api/smartsheet/openapi/sheets/getsheet).

sightId.name: sightId
sightId.description: SightID of the sight being accessed.

sightInclude.name: include
sightInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of optional elements to include in the response:
  * **objectValue** - when used in combination with a **level** query parameter, includes the email addresses for multi-contact data.
  * **source** - the Source object for any Sight that was created from another Sight, if any

sightLevel.name: level
sightLevel.description: Specifies whether new functionality, such as multi-contact data is returned in a backwards-compatible, text format (**level=0**, default), multi-contact data (**level=2**), multi-picklist data (**level=3**), or Metric widget with sheet summary (**level=4**).

emailInclude.name: email
emailInclude.description: Comma-separated list of email addresses on which to filter the results.

lastLoginInclude.name: include
lastLoginInclude.description:
If the API request is submitted by a system administrator and when specified with a value of 'lastLogin', response includes a lastLogin attribute for each user that indicates the Last login date/time of the user.

**Note** If the number of users included in the response is > 100, you must paginate your query to see the lastLogin attribute. For large responses, the lastLogin attribute is never included.

userProfileInclude.name: include
userProfileInclude.description: When specified with a value of 'groups', response includes an array of groups (groupId, name, and description only) that the user is a member of.

workspaceCreateInclude.name: include
workspaceCreateInclude.description:
A comma-separated list of elements to include:
  * **all**
  * **attachments**
  * **brand**
  * **cellLinks** - includes cross-sheet references
  * **data** - includes formatting
  * **discussions** - includes comments
  * **filters**
  * **forms**
  * **ruleRecipients**
  * **rules**
  * **shares**
NOTE: Cell history is not copied, regardless of which include parameter values are specified.

workspaceId.name: workspaceId
workspaceId.description: WorkspaceID of the worksheet being accessed.
